private_information: I control the left peg and currently hold disks top->bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F.
I can move only the top disk and only to a peg where it will not be placed on a smaller disk.
left_peg.goal: Move all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I control the middle peg and currently hold no disks.
I can receive or give the top disk subject to legality rules.
middle_peg.goal: Move all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I control the right peg and currently hold no disks.
I can receive or give the top disk subject to legality rules.
right_peg.goal: Move all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg states and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that solves the six-disk Tower of Hanoi instance by moving all disks from left to right.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are six disks labeled A (smallest) to F (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initially left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F; middle and right pegs are empty.
The objective is to move the entire stack to the right peg preserving order.

state.system_prompt: You represent the left peg in the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Describe your local stack from top to bottom and list which single-disk moves are immediately legal from your peg to the other pegs. Do not produce PDDL.
state.prompt: Provide the current stack on the left peg and the legal moves available for its top disk given the public rules. Keep the description precise and factual and do not produce PDDL.

state.system_prompt: You represent the middle peg in the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Describe your local stack from top to bottom and list which single-disk moves are immediately legal from your peg to the other pegs. Do not produce PDDL.
state.prompt: Provide the current stack on the middle peg and the legal moves available for its top disk given the public rules. Keep the description precise and factual and do not produce PDDL.

state.system_prompt: You represent the right peg in the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Describe your local stack from top to bottom and list which single-disk moves are immediately legal from your peg to the other pegs. Do not produce PDDL.
state.prompt: Provide the current stack on the right peg and the legal moves available for its top disk given the public rules. Keep the description precise and factual and do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an orchestrator that receives local peg state descriptions and must produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner to solve the six-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: Using the public information and the peg state descriptions provided, generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the six-disk Tower of Hanoi with pegs left, middle, and right and disks A (smallest) to F (largest). Ensure moves respect the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one and that only one disk moves at a time. The initial state places all disks on left (top->bottom A,B,C,D,E,F) and the goal places all disks on right (top->bottom A,B,C,D,E,F). Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Target FastDownwards.
